pr_title: HIVE-22957: Support Partition Filtering In MSCK REPAIR TABLE Command

timeline.message: HIVE-22957: Add Option For Predicate Filtering In MSCK REPAIR TABLE Command

timeline.bodyText:
I don't think this will work - this is the ql module ; while EXPRESSION_PROXY_CLASS is a metastore conf key; in a remote metastore setup this set will probably have no effect...
have you tried it?
I think making a check and returning with an error that this feature is not available due to required conf change is fine
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Yes, It won't work with remote metastore. Currently only planning for embedded metastore, Sure, we should bail out if conditions are not met. Currently i have added the bail out code in HiveMetaStoreChecker. But i feel bail out should have been much more earlier. I Couldn't think of a better spot. Any thoughts on this?
replies.author: shameersss1

replies.bodyText:
I think it would be great to throw an exception here; I think you should throw the type SemanticException
Throwing exceptions from in the Analyzer classes works nicely! :)
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: why this needs to be flattened into a byte[] ?
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: PartitionPruner and msc.listPartitionsByExpr() expects serialized byte array, Hence it is required to flatten out.
replies.author: shameersss1

timeline.bodyText:
can we find a new home for these 2 static methods? :)
ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/parse/ParseUtils.java
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -837,6 +844,118 @@ public static void checkColumnName(String columnName) throws SemanticException {
     return colList;
   }
 
+  /**
+   * Get the partition specs from the tree. This stores the full specification
+   * with the comparator operator into the output list.
+   *
+   * @return Map of partitions by prefix length. Most of the time prefix length will
+   *         be the same for all partition specs, so we can just OR the expressions.
+   */
+  public static Map<Integer, List<ExprNodeGenericFuncDesc>> getFullPartitionSpecs(

timeline.bodyText: is there a successor of this test?
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: I think the qtests handles most of cases
replies.author: shameersss1

timeline.bodyText: I wonder if there is a way to retain filterExp in a more natural way....it will be kryo-encoded almost all the time...but seems like the metastore interface method was designed to accept kryo stuff...
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: I though this initially but it becomes difficult to serialize filter exp once we move out of ql code, Hence did the kyro stuff in the initial stage
replies.author: shameersss1

replies.bodyText: yeah I understand...sometimes we have to cook from what we have :D
replies.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: this method accepts byte[] and if I'm not wrong this is like this since around 2013
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think we also pass byte array
replies.author: shameersss1

timeline.bodyText: move this variable inside the if
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: instead of concatenating with / use new Path(parentPath,child) - it's more portable
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: I'm wondering if tablePath could end with a '/' or not; if it does, and checkPartitionDirs are removing double slashes this could eat up 1 extra char...
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk

timeline.bodyText: you could avoid the null/empty check by using: !PartitionExpressionForMetastore.class.getCanonicalName()).equals(expressionProxyClass)
timeline.author: kgyrtkirk
